item.title: Bottles, cans, litter, glass and a bag littering, 20th June
item.description:
Glass, cans, bottles and litter deposited in foot path. Also weeds growing either side.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Edmunds Avenue, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Very narrow road and difficult to park car at 44 Firs lane due to card parking opposite the house, 20th June
item.description:
Three cars usually park opposite 44 Firs lane. This makes it very congested on the road and difficult to park inside 44 Firs lane. Backing the car out is also extremely difficult. Ideally this area opposite the house should be empty and have a sign of no parking.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Firs Avenue, Friern Barnet, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Harvist Road/Queens Park, 20th June
item.description:
The red telephone box needs to be investigated immediately. It has nazi graffiti on it and the door doesn't even open. This is beyond unacceptable! Brent Council must take immediate action!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Harvist Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Winchester Avenue/Brondesbury Park, 20th June
item.description:
These white lines must be repainted immediately! While I took these pictures, the car attempted to turn right at this left-turn junction, resulting in a confrontation with the cyclist. This dangerous conflict is a direct result of Brent Council’s failure to maintain clear road markings! Brent Council must urgently inspect and restore all faded white lines, especially at critical intersections!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salusbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 47 Winchester Avenue, 20th June

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Winchester Avenue, Kilburn, London
